comments.body: Normally I'd prefer changes like these come from a PR without recipes. However, this is so minor it seems ok. Though TBH we probably should rewrite this comment as it is a bit long and vague.
Went ahead and cherry-picked this commit into PR ( https://github.com/conda-forge/staged-recipes/pull/2144 ). Please rebase to clear this out of this PR.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +3,7 @@    ignore:
      # We only want to build pull requests for testing. If something is merged,
      # then we are prepping for release and there is no need to build it again.
      - master

comments.body: Seems this line works around the git repo caching issues effectively on CircleCI. See [build](https://circleci.com/gh/conda-forge/staged-recipes/8399).

Should note this is in contrast to [build](https://circleci.com/gh/conda-forge/staged-recipes/8394), which is using the cached repo. Note `master` includes `vtk`, which was [merged](https://github.com/conda-forge/staged-recipes/commit/e8c8e9f3376533c9281819976ade9eb2b9145076) and then [removed](https://github.com/conda-forge/staged-recipes/commit/8387f946979462901b0930b669e21ee923f6bbe8) after conversion a couple of months back. Hence why we need to refresh the repo.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +9,13 @@  post:
    # Update the `master` branch. Otherwise CircleCI will give us a cached one.
    - git fetch -u origin +master:master
